heisig_chinese_memo: Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch!

koohiiStory1: Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch! http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg.
koohiiStory2: I really hate the primitive meaning of "table" for "bean." I just use "bean." Anyways, for the DRUM primitive, imagine a SAMURAI who beats on a DRUM with two chopsticks, and a BEAN skewered on each end of the chopstick to produce a better sound. And the obvious story is: "DRUMing on a DRUM with a huge BRANCH".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You take a drum and a branch and... well, what else would you do? You would drum or beat them together.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: A branch is just like a drumstick, so of course you're going to drum them together.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who loves to drum things together and make a huge racket? Â≠ês („Åì), of course.

Bronze inscriptions are used as verbs to indicate beating. Wang Sun's survivor's bell: "The grandson of the grandson of the world will keep the drum forever." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to indicate drumming. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 48: "Three drums to advance, three drums to retreat."

Ancient drums are often used in wars to command the advance and retreat of the army, as well as for banquets and sacrifices. The verb " drum " not only means to beat the drum, but also to beat other percussion instruments. The drums are loud and majestic, and beating the big drum can increase courage. Therefore, with the language of "inspiration", the way of slapping the belly and feeling satisfied with life can be described as "puffing" (Shirakawa Jing). According to ancient times, the appearance of a belly bulging like a drum after eating is described as "puffing". The meaning of courage may also be derived from full of righteousness.

(11) Waving; dancing.
(12) Use a wind box and other fans (wind).
(13) (The wind blows) to inflate.
(14) Protruding; swelling.
(15) Excite; cheer up.
(16) Incitement; incitement.

(18) Musician who plays drums.
(19) The shape, function, and sound are like drums.
(20) Hair accessories covered in a bun.

(22) Names of ancient measuring instruments or weighing instruments. There are different opinions about its capacity or weight.
(23) Metering.
